inputs.billPdfText:
PG&E
Commercial Electric Service

Rate Schedule: B-19
Service Agreement: 0000000000
Billing Period: 2026-01-01 to 2026-01-31

This is sanitized bill text for deterministic testing. No customer data.

because: Behavior insights built from months=2; reconcilable overlap=0.

customerQuestions: What processes or equipment typically run during the peak hour window?
Are peaks driven by HVAC, charging, or batch processes?
Please confirm operating schedule / equipment change.
insightCards.finding: Peak demand clusters around 00:00, mostly on weekdays.

likelyCauses.cause: Process scheduling may indicate peaks during specific hours
HVAC scheduling may indicate afternoon peaks
EV or fleet charging may indicate off-hour clustering
TOU labeling or rate mapping may indicate timing shifts

recommendedNextSteps: Confirm operating schedules for the identified peak window.
Check whether peaks align with tariff TOU periods.
Review any curtailment or automation policies.
insightCards.whyItMatters: Peak timing affects demand charges and informs load shifting opportunities.

customerQuestions: Have always-on loads or controls drifted over the last 12-24 months?
Did any 24/7 equipment get added or left running?
Please confirm operating schedule / equipment change.
insightCards.finding: Base load appears increasing by about 0.09 kW/month.

likelyCauses.cause: Always-on equipment growth may indicate base load creep
Controls drift may indicate higher idle consumption
Process changes may indicate new continuous loads
Metering changes may indicate baseline shifts

recommendedNextSteps: Inventory always-on equipment and controls settings.
Check overnight baseload profiles in intervals.
insightCards.whyItMatters: Rising base load increases costs even without production growth.
